page.title: 18Jubilee Bridge - Appleby
page.content: The bridge is set on the river Eden and below Castle Hill and it is next to Bongate Mill.The first bridge was built in 1887 and it was made out of iron and wood.In 1968 flood waters washed it away and in 1970 it was afficialy opened by the Mayor of Appleby.The ford next to the bridge was used as a tractor crossing for vehicles bringing corn to the mill. There are a variety of plants and animals around Jubilee Bridge.In the plant section there are daffodils, daisies and buttercups.The River Eden is well stocked with fish and is well known as a game fishing river.Birds such as herons and coots abound.Small mammals such as squirrels are common. Jubilee Bridge is a favourite place for children for swimming,raft building and fishing. Kevin Winder Freddie Potts
